meanings.definition: The act of cutting off the excess or unwanted parts of something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully removed the trimmings from the fabric to make it fit perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The barber offered to give him a haircut with all the trimmings - a wash, cut, and style.
meanings.sent3: After the party, she jokingly said she needed some trimmings herself to get rid of the extra cake slices.
meanings.sent4: His sharp wit was like the trimmings of a master tailor, cutting away the unnecessary to reveal the essence.
meanings.sent5: The trimmings of her speech were precise and to the point, leaving no room for confusion.

meanings.definition: Decorative items or accessories added to enhance the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: The Christmas tree was adorned with colorful trimmings and twinkling lights.
meanings.sent2: The dress was beautiful on its own, but the trimmings of lace and beads made it truly stunning.
meanings.sent3: His car was so full of trimmings that it looked like a moving decoration shop.
meanings.sent4: The trimmings on the cake were so intricate, they almost outshone the main design.
meanings.sent5: She loved to add trimmings to her artwork, making each piece unique and eye-catching.

meanings.definition: Leftover pieces or scraps from a larger item.
meanings.sent1: She gathered the trimmings of fabric to create a patchwork quilt.
meanings.sent2: The chef used the trimmings from the vegetables to make a flavorful broth.
meanings.sent3: The trimmings of wood left over from the project were used to build a small birdhouse.
meanings.sent4: The trimmings of paper on the floor showed that someone had been working on a craft project.
meanings.sent5: He collected the trimmings of metal to recycle and reduce waste in the workshop.
